CV/a060.title: REHA.Complete
CV/a060.content:
A CRM printing functionality backend developer within a 800 database table- 25-people team and 8-years legacy monolith project.
Stack:

Java 8
PDFBox, Jasper Reports (Embedded + Standalone)
Spring (IoC; REST), Apache Tomcat, JDBC, MapStruct, DozerMapper, Jackson Mapper, Apache Camel
JPA: Hibernate, SQL, Oracle Database, Liquibase
JUnit, Mockito, Spring Test
JProfiler
svn, git, Maven, GitLab, Jenkins

Architecture / patterns / mechanisms:


bus, templates, status transitions, pessimistick locking


Implemented backend and frontend document PDF printing functionality.


115 features implemented. 492 bugs fixed.


Participated in the team of 14 devs, 3 automation QA, 6 manual QA, a UX engineer. A sub-team I worked in: test engineer, architect, team lead, 2 developers.


Processed several code review requests on the daily basis.


Wrote technical patch notes describing my implementation.


Provided unit-test coverage for the implemented functionality.


Conducted the 30-hour java core introduction for automation QA.


Mentored students through the Deutsche Telekom IT Solutions Java school ‚Äò18 and ‚Äò19.


The web CRM for Austrian government rehabilitation healthcare organization. The application handles the entire lifecycle of clinical orders, vital signs management, printing reports, diagnoses management, and other aspects of clinic operations.

heap/03e2.title: dynamic programming
heap/03e2.content:
Lecture 19: Dynamic Programming I: Fibonacci, Shortest Paths
BF recursion

–æ–±—Ä—É–±–∏—Ç—å –≤ –ª—é–±–æ–π –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç pre-calculated –∏ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è—è –Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Å—á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Å –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –≥–¥–µ —É–∂–µ –ø–æ—Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–æ
DP is just doing brute force recursion smartly. [try all decisions first](leetcode.com/problems/target-sum/solutions/455024/dp-is-easy-5-steps-to-think-through-dp-questions/#:~:text=‚Äúall decisions first‚Äù)

DP is just backtracking with if‚Äôs and cache to reduce the calculations, that‚Äôs why backtracking is important here

SAGA pattern is something like Spring @Transactional annotation with propagation = REQUIRED:

















Spring @Transactional(propagation = REQUIRED)SagaSpans several classesSpans several servicesManager with visibility for several classesHas visibility for several services
Compensating transactions - each developer should invest time of rolling back.
Orchestration - is like using a manager
Choreography - transactions are executed like a linked list, no manager.

heap/6c6d.title: Quartz
heap/6c6d.content:
www.google.com/search+notes
Where can I take quartz build command not to store locally?
Dropped all the permalinks. The permalinks can be restored by using what obisidian plugin?
Deploy
I want to have an automatic local developer machine mechanism to deploy my .md notes to my digital garden quartz.jzhao.xyz/

The main problem is tha original files have different folder structure and files for deployment are selected by tags. Currently I run the process manually.



I have number of notes, but I want to publish only a subset of those notes marked with tags.

The steps:
- clean-install approach:
	- clean quartz content folder
	- clean quartz public folder (rendered to html)
- filter all md notes based on the tags starting from specific and copy them to target folders:
	- "publish-to-garden" + "cv" - should be moved to target folder ./quartz/content/cv/
	- "publish-to-garden" - a general last-stand tag indicates the fact that the note should be published. In that case file should go to ./quartz/content/heap/.
- execute npx quartz build
- copy ./quartz/public/ (a rendered ouput) to another "public" repository (catalog) - should be customizable
- execute git add . && git commit -m deploy && git push
    
What instrument is best for that?
